channel.title: Returning Computer to Factory Condition; Will it Work?
channel.description:
I just started playing minecraft and it's the best computer game I've ever played, but I can't do anything due to the lag... Will
restoring my computer to factory condition and completely wiping everything out make it less laggy? I don't have any important
files so it's no problem. I understand I could go and build my own computer, or go out and buy one, but I don't know how to build
and I don't have the money for a new one. Will it work?

item.title: Returning Computer to Factory Condition; Will it Work?
item.dc:creator: @h1_sk1ller h1 sk1ller
item.description:
@h1_sk1ller wrote:

Have you tried opti-mine? Or is that outdated now? Oh yeah and try opti-fine (as posted above), I don’t really lag on any games but still using an average pc so I don’t know if they will help a LOT but you could try

Read full topic
item.source: Returning Computer to Factory Condition; Will it Work?

item.title: Returning Computer to Factory Condition; Will it Work?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

marine5289:

Does installing mods make it more laggy?

WAIT there is a mod out there that actually improves performance rather than reduce. This glorious mod is known as Optifine, a wonderful god-given mod for people like you.
http://www.minecraftforum.net/topic/249637-100-optifine-hd-b2-fps-boost-hd-textures/

Read full topic

item.title: Returning Computer to Factory Condition; Will it Work?
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

[quote=“marine5289, post:5, topic:424386”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=527042.msg3840808#msg3840808 date=1323213566]

I just started playing minecraft and it’s the best computer game I’ve ever played, but I can’t do anything due to the lag… Will

restoring my computer to factory condition and completely wiping everything out make it less laggy? I don’t have any important

files so it’s no problem. I understand I could go and build my own computer, or go out and buy one, but I don’t know how to build

and I don’t have the money for a new one. Will it work?

Post the specs.

Intel® Pentium® CPU GHz
P6100 @ 2.00GHz 2.00GHz
3.00GB
64-bit

Is that a laptop?
[/quote]

Yes sorry a Gateway Laptop.[/quote]
Yes it may help.

Read full topic
item.source: Returning Computer to Factory Condition; Will it Work?

item.title: Returning Computer to Factory Condition; Will it Work?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“marine5289, post:5, topic:424386”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=527042.msg3840808#msg3840808 date=1323213566]

I just started playing minecraft and it’s the best computer game I’ve ever played, but I can’t do anything due to the lag… Will

restoring my computer to factory condition and completely wiping everything out make it less laggy? I don’t have any important

files so it’s no problem. I understand I could go and build my own computer, or go out and buy one, but I don’t know how to build

and I don’t have the money for a new one. Will it work?

Post the specs.

Intel® Pentium® CPU GHz
P6100 @ 2.00GHz 2.00GHz
3.00GB
64-bit

Is that a laptop?
[/quote]

Yes sorry a Gateway Laptop.[/quote]

Then no, it probably wont help a whole lot.

I mean sure, you could try restoring it to factory settings, defrag the hard drive, etc and see if the performance improves, but it probably wont.

Also, the only way I’ve been able to play with decent performance is with all the settings at the bare minimum (Graphics: Fast, )

Read full topic
item.source: Returning Computer to Factory Condition; Will it Work?
